alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing; South Cass (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 4:02PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN CASS AND SOUTHWESTERN CROW WING COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM CDT... At 402 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Ripley, or 13 miles southwest of Brainerd, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Saint Mathias around 410 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Baxter, Brainerd and Merrifield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for north central and east central Minnesota.
